com.jbion.utils.xml

Class XmlHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jbion.utils.xml.XmlHelper

  • public class XmlHelper
extends Object
    A helper class to perform usual operations to create or read XML files.
    Author:
    Joffrey BION

      • createEmptyDomDocument

        public static Document createEmptyDomDocument()
        Creates a new empty DOM Document.
        Returns:
        the created Document.

      • getDomDocumentFromFile

        public static Document getDomDocumentFromFile(String xmlFilePath)
                                       throws SAXException,
                                              IOException
        Parses the specified XML file and returns it as a Document.
        Parameters:
        xmlFilePath - The path to the file to parse.
        Returns:
        The Document created from the file.
        Throws:
        SAXException - If any parse error occurs.
        IOException - If any IO error occurs.

      • getFirstDirectChild

        public static Element getFirstDirectChild(Element parent,
                          String tag)
        Returns the first direct child of the given element whose name matches tag.

        Example: let the Element root correspond to: 

         <root>
     <name>
         <first>John</first>
         <last>Smith</last>
     </name>
     <last>BlahBlah</last>
 </root>
 
 getFirstDirectChild(root, "last"); // returns the element corresponding to <last>BlahBlah</last>

        Parameters:
        parent - The Element to get the child from.
        tag - The element name of the child to look for.
        Returns:
        The Element corresponding to the child if any was found, null otherwise.

      • getDirectChildren

        public static LinkedList<Element> getDirectChildren(Element parent)
        Returns a list of the direct Element children of the given element.
        Parameters:
        parent - The Element to get the children from.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList of the children Elements.

      • getDirectChildren

        public static LinkedList<Element> getDirectChildren(Element parent,
                                    String tag)
        Returns a list of the direct Element children of the given element whose names match tag.
        Parameters:
        parent - The Element to get the children from.
        tag - The element name of the children to look for.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList of the children Elements.

      • createField

        public static Element createField(Document doc,
                  String tag,
                  String text)
        Creates an element representing <tag>text</tag>.
        Parameters:
        doc - The Document containing the Element.
        tag - The tag name of the created Element.
        text - The content of the created Element.
        Returns:
        the Element created.

      • appendField

        public static Element appendField(Document doc,
                  Element parent,
                  String tag,
                  String text)
        Creates an element representing <tag>text</tag> and appends it to parent.
        Parameters:
        doc - The Document containing the Element.
        parent - The Node to append the created Element to.
        tag - The tag name of the created Element.
        text - The content of the created Element.
        Returns:
        the Element created.

      • getField

        public static String getField(Element ancestor,
              String tag)
        Returns the content of the first descendant of ancestor matching the specified tag.

        Example: let the Element root correspond to: 

         <root>
     <name>
         <first>John</first>
         <last>Smith</last>
     </name>
     <last>BlahBlah</last>
 </root>
 
 getField(root, "last"); // returns "Smith"

        Parameters:
        ancestor - The starting point in the XML tree to look for descendants.
        tag - The tag of the desired descendant.
        Returns:
        The content of the first descendant of ancestor matching the tag, or null if no such descendant exists.

      • getContent

        public static String getContent(Node node)
        Returns the content of the specified node.

        Example: 

         <name>John</name>
 
 getContent(name); // returns "John"

        Parameters:
        node - The node to get the field child from.
        Returns:
        The content of the specified node, or null if no such content exists.

      • writeXml

        public static void writeXml(String filePath,
            Document doc)
                     throws IOException
        Writes the specified DOM Document to the specified XML file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the XML output file.
        doc - The Document to write.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing to the file.
